pullrequest.title: Deprecate Event::Disconnect(ConnectionPtr) in favor of reseting the ConnectionPtr

content.raw:
The `Connection` class can only be connected through its constructor; it doesn't have any `Set` functions. After calling `Disconnect`, there's no way to re-connect it to an event.

It seems simplest to me just to destruct it, rather than write a bunch of extra code to allow reuse of a `Connection` object.

The one final pull request I would still propose is to change the `ConnectionPtr` type from `shared_ptr` to `unique_ptr`. This would make object destruction more straight-forward, since there wouldn't be any lingering references.
